description: Lying in the sought-after Cherry Tree Conservation Area of W8, this elegant period home has been reimagined with family life in mind, blending classic features with a chic, contemporary finish. Bifold doors lead directly to the garden, while integrated Miele appliances, white cabinetry, a grey stone floor and a sleek kitchen island make for a clean and considered culinary space. A utility room and powder room are also found on this floor. <PARA> Up on the ground level, an elegant double reception room takes in views over both the garden and the street. This floor also has a welcoming entrance hall and a second guest WC. <PARA> The first floor is entirely dedicated to the principal suite. A generous bedroom is paired with a marble-clad ensuite bathroom, where a freestanding tub sits in front of the window, accessed via a walk-through dressing room. <PARA> Two further ensuite bedrooms sit on the second floor, along with an additional fridge/storage area on the half-landing. The top floor has another ensuite bedroom and a vast dressing room, which could easily be reconfigured into an additional bedroom if needed. A spiral staircase leads up to the crowning glory of the house, a private roof terrace that spans the entire footprint of the home, with far-reaching city views. <PARA> Set between leafy Kensington and electric Notting Hill, the house is perfectly placed for both calm and connection. The area is rich in independent schools, Pembridge Hall, Wetherby and Thomas?s are all within easy reach, and green space abounds, with Holland Park and Kensington Gardens on the doorstep.
